content.description: Leave the ground on steepish rock avoiding the devil bush (velcro bush) and pull up into the pod by the first bolt.  Grab a big comfy jug..clip bolt 2 and do a couple steep moves on good and comfy jugs.  Clip bolt 3 and head up vertical rock on nice edges to the pocket rail.  Clip bolt 4 and climb the technical and sharpish holds to the anchors.
content.protection:
1 older bolt (still seems solid; circa the rest of the bolts at GC) + 3 stainless bolts and a double mussy anchor. 

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent.  No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents.  Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety.  Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.
content.location: The far right route on the left/shady wall. 25 feet right of Sharpest Shot.  The route was listed as "project" in Islands in the Sky...10+ years later it is now a pretty fun route.

content.description:
This route climbs an obvious line starting at the low corner. 

This route is more difficult than it appears, and can be made easier by climbing right of the bolt line on the positive holds.
content.protection: Six bolts to  2 bolt steel anchor.   Anchor has been updated.
content.location: This is the sixth route on the left as you head up the hill trail. Start at the low corner just below the small boulders you sit on to change your shoes.  =)

content.description:
This route is a fun warmup and has some good movement in it. There is a small runout between the third and fourth bolts, but the climbing is on easy, albeit questionable rock. Overall, worth doing. This used to share anchors with High Caliber, so it makes for a good way to hang draws on that route.

If top roping this climb, be aware of pendulum potential with anchors being far to the left of the start.
content.location: On the slabby arete on the far right side of the wall. First route left of the gully that splits the wall. First bolt is high, but easy climbing.

content.description: Bouldery off the ground to sharp pockets and sidepulls in bullet silver limestone.
content.location: Located to the left of the popular 11d route on the left hand side of the Gun Club.

content.description: Start at the pocket low down on the wall and climb straight up the sharp edges. This route has a runout after the third bolt on easier climbing.
content.protection: Five bolts and then a runout to cold shuts up to the right.
content.location: This route starts in the small opening at the bottom of the wall. Begin climbing at the obvious pocket down low.

content.description: Starts on and amazing side-pull hueco just left of a low arete and proceeds up and left past a second bolt and the 1st jugs. Proceeds straight up  through a bulge transitioning to a left-leaning crack and an easy run-out to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to the open shuts + extra boklt with chain anchor shared with Skeet Surfin'.

content.description: SHARP!   Sharp is an inadequate word to describe the holds on this route.  Pull a steepish start to some slabby moves to a steep ending on sharp rock.
content.protection:
1 older bolt (still seems solid).  +4 Stainless Bolts to a double mussy anchor. 

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent.  No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents.  Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety.  Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.
content.location: 20 Feet Right of Small Arms.  25 feet left of Young Guns.  The first bolt is older (circa most of the other routes at the GC).  The route was listed as  "project" in Islands in the Sky...10+ years later it is now a route.

content.description: Crimpy and fun to 5.8 runout on top.
content.location: Second Route on the left wall.

content.description: Starts just left of Under Fire, just before the section of lighter rock begins. Missing the hanger on the first bolt, so a stick clip for the second would be wise, given that the crux is within the first ten feet.
content.location: Left of Under Fire (shares anchors with that route).

climbs.name: High Caliber
climbs.fa: Danny Rider, Paul Van Betton, Shelby Shelton

content.description:
Difficult start move leads to easier climbing to the 2nd bolt. Launch into the crux for a few more bolts, then arrive at a good rest. Awkward climbing for a few more bolts takes you to the anchor. 

  This route shares anchors with Small Arms, so climbing that route makes it easy to hang draws on this one if you want to.
content.location: Right side of the wall, starting in an undercut, shallow dihedral just left of the prominent slabby arete.

content.description: A traverse-y moderate that shares the start with Gun Fetish. Crux is through the first couple bolts, then follow the bolt line left up the dihedral on easier terrain. Shares anchors with another fun looking route to the left that we didn't have time to get on. Should be cleaned by following instead of rapping/lowering because of how far this climb leans to the left.
content.location: Towards the right end of the south wall, starts on top of a few fallen boulders twenty feet left of High Caliber.

content.description: Climb takes you up into a hueco where you can clip the third bolt. The Crux is right before the fourth bolt as you're navigating the bulge. Beyond the fourth bolt there's about 20ft of runout of 5.7 climbing (R rating). The fifth bolt and anchors come as the pitch steepens again. You might consider bringing a couple medium sized nuts to protect the runout section if you have some available.
content.protection: Four bolts to the runout followed by one more bolt to open/shut anchors.
content.location: Climb is located directly right of Skeet Surfin' and left of Sharpshooter.

content.description:
Bouldery start on slopers and smooth limestone leads to sharp limestone bulge side-pulling, heel hooking, crimping, and smearing!  Surmount the crux/arete to a huge jug and then tiptoe to the top.  There are two bolts here but only one has chains.  Consider continuing up and right to Slingblade (I think?) for actual lowering chains.

 Took a guess on the rating.  Felt around 12c.  Still some crumbly cauliflower.
content.location: Several routes left of High Caliber.  Start on top of a rock and clip a low bolt.  After clipping the second bolt, head straight up.  Alternatively, there is a right-facing, left-leaning dihedral with a crack to lower-off that looks like it's relatively easy.

content.description: Sharp jugs spaced for decent sized pulls with an easy run-out past the 3rd bolt to the anchors.

A fun but not very sustained moderate. Crux comes at the second bolt and will probably feel 10- for taller people or 10+ if you're shorter. Finishes right of Under Fire, up past 2 more bolts to rap rings at the top of the cliff. Also makes for reasonable TR access.
content.location: Right of Under Fire, climbs up past the large bush on a ledge.

content.description: The Southern (north facing) wall at The Gun Club.
